Entries.default: The kith present an odd trio, a broad-shouldered elf flanked by a tall aumaua and a wild-haired orlan. Each holds weapons at the ready as the woman steps forward. She bears an improvised flail made from a ball and chain.
"With this, we can return to the Reach. Thank you."
"You wanted to talk. Talk."
"What are you three doing out here?"
"I mostly wanted to stop being shot at."
"Is there anything I can do to help?"
[Attack.] "Now that you're out in the open, you don't look so tough."
"Hiding, obviously. When we're not shooting trespassers. Or people who ask ridiculous questions."
"You could have accomplished that by turning back at the warning."
[Leave.] "Maybe another time."
Cathŵenna's limpid eyes linger on yours, wrinkling slightly at the corners.
"You claimed you were a godly sort. Perhaps you trade in charity as well as conversion."
"That's the second time you've offered to assist us..." She sighs, frowning.
"You seem to have a penchant for brutality... that can be quite lucrative in the Deadfire."
"What you said before, back on the path, it suggested a certain... familiarity... with what we face." Sighing, she drags her free hand down her face.
"If you have the coin to spare - say six thousand pands worth - that could help us leave this place for good."
"Of course. I'm happy to help."
"Six thousand? I don't suppose you have something to offer in trade?"
"I'm sorry, I don't have that much coin."
Her eye twitches as she hefts the flail.
"There will be no other time. You return here, there will be no talking. But suit yourself."
"I thought you were leaving." The elf frowns at you, muscles tense.
"You mentioned Crookspur. Were you slaves?"
She snorts, then spits on the ground.
"We were abducted. Held against our wills. Offered to the highest bidder."
"So yes."
Her eyes narrow to a knife's edge.
"That's the word the scum who sell kith use to justify their manacles. Do you see any slavers here?"
"She ain't farting out her mouth, cap. Slave's a branding given you by another, even if you be born to it."
"So you don't own these animals?"
"We do not. They are our companions. We help them, they help us." She shifts the weight of the flail over her shoulder. "You try our patience."
"You could leave... and forget you were ever here. I wouldn't trust you to do more than that."
"Ha! No."
"I'm sorry, I don't have that much coin."
"That doesn't surprise me. It's no small sum."
"That doesn't surprise me. It's no small sum."
"Of course you don't." Her lips tighten.
The aumaua chuckles, earning a glare from Cathŵenna.
Her nose wrinkles, and she glances to her compatriots. Finally her eyes settle on her flail.
"Truly?" Her eyes widen as she accepts the purse of assorted coins.
"Short of that, though, I can't think of anything else you can offer us that we don't already have."
"I made this by my own hand, and it has crushed the heads of several slavers who've come after us." She rests a hand gingerly on the iron ball.
"I would offer it in trade for the silver. If that's what it takes."
"Go. While you still can."
"Here, take the coin. Keep your weapon."
"I accept your terms."
"I have a ship. I could take you away from here."
The trio exchange quick glances, and you catch the smallest shake of the head from the orlan. Cathŵenna turns back to you.
"An admirable offer, but one we cannot accept. Nothing personal. We just don't trust you."
"Nothing personal about that at all."
With the first slight smile you've seen from the elf, Cathŵenna shrugs.
She takes the purse from you in exchange for the flail.
Her fingers linger on the weapon, as if reluctant to let it go, but the weight of the purse seems to decide the issue.

"Thank you. With this... with this, we have a chance."

She smiles faintly and bows her head to you.
"Make the most of it... and stay safe."
"It always falls to me to help those too incompetent to help themselves."
[Attack] "I just wanted to get that flail out of your hands."
[Leave] "Farewell."
She nods. "We will. Farewell, our friend of fortune."
She blinks, scowls, and finally smirks, each expression chasing the last from her face in rapid succession.
"Someone has to help us incompetents. Farewell."
Her eyes narrow.
